name: Baby Back Ribs
author: KHEFFN
summary: These are tender and the meat falls right off the bone. Generally, people think of baby back ribs as a meal they would only order when at a restaurant, but they are so easy to make at home. This recipe could not be any more simple.
directions: Tear off 4 pieces of aluminum foil big enough to enclose each portion of ribs
Spray each piece of foil with vegetable cooking spray
Brush the ribs liberally with barbeque sauce and place each portion in its own piece of foil
Wrap tightly and refrigerate for at least 8 hours, or overnight
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
Bake ribs wrapped tightly in the foil at 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) for 2 1/2 hours
Remove from foil and add more sauce, if desired
